thread.title: UP elections: When PM Narendra Modi voiced a ‘complaint’ against Aligarh people and got a rousing ‘No’
thread.title_full: UP elections: When PM Narendra Modi voiced a ‘complaint’ against Aligarh people and got a rousing ‘No’

author: FE Online
title: UP elections: When PM Narendra Modi voiced a ‘complaint’ against Aligarh people and got a rousing ‘No’
text:
UP elections: When PM Narendra Modi voiced a ‘complaint’ against Aligarh people and got a rousing ‘No’ UP elections: When PM Narendra Modi voiced a ‘complaint’ against Aligarh people and got a rousing ‘No’ He said, I have a 'complaint' against the people of Aligarh and added, 'Will you mind if I express this complaint?" The response from the gathered public was immediate - it roared its approval in an ear-splitting 'No' each and every time. By: FE Online | Aligarh | Published: February 5, 2017 2:31 PM Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Aligarh. (ANI) 
In his latest speech at an election rally, PM Narendra Modi looked to make a strong statement right in the beginning and play up to the galleries to indicate what was playing on his mind as well as indicate his awe and surprise. He said, I have a ‘complaint’ against the people of Aligarh and added, ‘Will you mind if I express this complaint?” He proceeded to ask the gathering the same question a number of times. The response from the gathered public was immediate – it roared its approval in an ear-splitting ‘No’ each and every time. PM said, “I hope the public does not mind, but In the last election I came to this venue for another rally and the maidaan was not even half-filled. Yet today here I am back again and what I see is astounding. As far as eye can see, there is a sea of people.” He said, “Wherever I look, I see the ‘kesariya’ (saffron flag) being waved. I can see that this time there is a storm of support coming for us in the Uttar Pradesh elections.” 
PM said, “I can read into this that there is overwhelming support for the BJP . That the work done by us and promises made have won over the people of UP.” Please Wait while comments are loading...
